intro: Hieracium cottetii subsp. squalidum, commonly known as the squalid hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is generally low-growing, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters.
